document.docTitle: Nephelomilta sumatrana subsp. sumatrana sumatrana (van Eecke 1927
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Nephelomilta Hampson, 1900, with descriptions of twelve new species and two new subspecies (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Nephelomilta Hampson, 1900, with descriptions of twelve new species and two new subspecies (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae)

heading.emphasis:
Nephelomilta sumatrana sumatrana (van Eecke, 1927)
, comb. & stat. nov.

Diagnosis . Length of forewing is 10.5–12 mm in males and 15–16 mm in females.
N. sumatrana
is a variable species: the size of moths, the hue of reddish pattern, the intensity of the dark suffusion of the hindwings, the width of the valve, and the size of the medial and distal diverticula in the male genitalia vary widely within the same subspecies. For the nominate subspecies the more orange hue of the forewing pattern, the more intense dark suffusion on the hindwings, and the smaller signum in the female genitalia are characteristic.
